page.title: 04LAND USE
page.content: The land is predominantly {pastoral,}except where steepness of slope (Lower Biddle Combe, King's Castle) has made cultivation impracticable and so{woodland}remains to form an attractive patchwork. The farms are mostly part of{large estates which may have been part of cathedral lands (e.g. Chilcote{prebendal manor). Formerly sheep farming and the wool industry were dominant, but railways in the 1860s led to the growth of dairying. Now largely{milk, beef, and {lamb fattening,}with a recent increase in{cereals}(assisted by E.E.C. grants) with{market garden/fruit growing}on the alluvial soils of the sheltered Sheppey Valley.Post_war{suburban Wells is fringed by an expanding{golf course and large{hospital}grounds. Villages lie along the Sheppey, with only one hamlet and some farms on the hills.
